comment.author: 41450896@N02
comment._content: Great photo - they're Hawker Sea Furies

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hoppieno3] Thanks for the info! Our records have been updated. The Australian War Memorial have similar pics of the Sea Furies on the deck of HMAS SYDNEY: bit.ly/Sk7dHt
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 26273802@N06
comment._content: Thanks for posting this. It confirms my memory of being aboard the Sydney with my family, during a visit to Hobart in the early 1950s, including being taken down the aircraft lift, and seeing the aircraft with their wings folded. The distinctive nose of the Sea Fury, with its air intake around the propeller hub, has stayed in my memory ever since, so it's good to have such an early memory validated.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/26273802@N06] Glad you like the image! It would have been amazing to see those planes in action, particularly taking off and landing on the carrier. There is a newspaper article that talks briefly about HMAS SYDNEY's visit to Hobart in early 1951 : bit.ly/SVcaUl
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
